Recipe.Title: Slow Cooker Taco Soup
Recipe.RecipeIntroduction: This is a quick, throw together slow cooker soup with a Mexican flair. Teenagers love it. Serve topped with corn chips, shredded Cheddar cheese and a dollop of sour cream. Make sure you adjust the amount of chile peppers if you're sensitive about spicy foods.

ToolTip.Text: THIS WILL BE FOR MEDIUM HEAT IN STEP Cook 1 - TODO

Browning means to cook the surface of meat, which results in a brown colour. Note that this does not necessarily mean the meat is cooked - In most cases it will be further cooked with other ingredients!

RecipeStep.StepText: In a medium skillet, cook 1 pound ground beef until browned over medium heat. Drain, and set aside.
RecipeStep.Title: Brown Ground Beef

RecipeStep.StepText: Place the cooked 1 pound ground beef, chipped onion, 16 ounce can chili beans (with liquid), 15 ounch can kidney beans (with liquid), 15 ounce can corn (with liquid), 8 ounce can tomato sauce, 2 cups water, 2 14.5 ounce cans diced tomatoes, 4 ounce can green chile peppers, and 1.25 ounce taco seasoning mix in a slow cooker. Mix to blend, and cook on Low setting for 8 hours.
RecipeStep.Title: Add Ingredients To Slow Cooker & Cook
